title: Merge connections panel and config panel
author: kmscode
body_snippet:
Request received via e-mail

Currently the Connections and the Config views appear on two separate panels/tabs and I find it awkward having to go back and forth between the two tabs. My suggestion is to have these two combined into a single view, similarly to a file manager. On the left side you would have the connections and on the right side you would see the configuration details of the currently selected connection. Please see mock-up belowΓÇª

![image 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/...

iterations.description: Major UI architecture redesign request from 2014 with no clear specification - merging the connections and config panels would require extensive WinForms layout restructuring that is out of scope for the current roadmap

comments.snippet:
https://mremoteng.atlassian.net/browse/MR-368

It seems a bit strange that connections and folders can be manipulated from the File menu even when the Connections panel isn't visible, i.e. you can be working blind.

Would it make sense for those entries to be greyed out while the Connections panel is not visible? Or to automatically show the Connections panel when any of those options are selected from the File menu?

notes:
AI triage: Major UI architecture redesign request from 2014 with no clear specification - merging the connections and config panels would require extensive WinForms layout restructuring that is out of scope for the current roadmap
Approach: Would require merging ConnectionTreeWindow and ConfigWindow into a single unified panel, restructuring DockPanel layout, and redesigning the property grid integration - too large and architectural for current priorities
